intro: Galium palustre, commonly known as marsh stitchwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy areas. It typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and has slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and usually have a slightly hairy texture. Galium palustre is known for its ability to thrive in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in areas with standing water.
